citation.article-title: Prochlorococcus marinus Chisholm et al. 1992 subsp. pastoris subsp. nov. strain PCC 9511, the first axenic chlorophyll a2/b2-containing cyanobacterium (Oxyphotobacteria).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Prochlorococcus marinus subsp. pastoris subsp. nov.
Prochlorococcus marinus subsp. pastoris (pa.sto'ris. Latinized form of Pasteur)
The type strain of the new subspecies, pastoris, is the axenic isolate PCC 9511 (=ATCC 700925).

The cells of this strain are 0.5-0.6 μmin width and 0.7-0.8 μm in length; thylakoids have a `horseshoe-like' opening at one pole of the cells; phycoerythrin is not produced and the genes encoding the α and β subunits of phycoerythrin (PE-III) have not been revealed in the genome; chlorophylls a2, b2 and Mg, 3-8 divinyl phaeoporphyrin a5 are synthesized, but chl b1 is lacking; the ratios of chlorophyll b2/a2 are less than 0.1.
As observed for all other non-axenic members of this genus, zeaxanthin and α-carotene are the major carotenoids.
Strain PCC 9511 uses ammonia and urea as the preferred sources of nitrogen, but is incapable of using nitrate.
Utilizable sources of phosphate are: Na-PO4 (pH 7.5), Na2-β-glycerophosphate, Na4-pyrophosphate, glucose 6-phosphate and ATP; the mean DNA base composition is 32 mol% G+C; genome size is 2 Mbp.
Based on morphology, pigment content and 16S rRNA sequence analyses, the type strain of this new subspecies is identical to the impure strain CCMP 1378 (MED4), isolated from the Mediterranean Sea.
Both are highly related to four other non-axenic isolates, CCMP 1426, NATL1, TATL2 and NATL2, which most likely are also assignable to the subspecies pastoris.

The former two differ from PCC 9511 by one base at two different positions; the latter exhibit two different base changes in the respective 16S rRNA sequences that cover a total of 1271 comparable bases.

In contrast, the type strain CCMP 1375T of the genus and proposed as Prochlorococcus marinus Chisholm et al. 1992 subsp. marinus subsp. nov., differs in the 16S rRNA gene sequence by 20-21 bases from all six members of the subspecies pastoris.
